We’re inspired by the power of biology and driven to build tools that make it possible to access that power in new ways.

Sepsis Quick Facts

“The failure to detect sepsis early in its course leads to preventable morbidity and mortality in the emergency room”

Nate Shaprio — MD in Emergency Medicine and Director of Translational Research Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center and Harvard Medical School

Sepsis — A Disease of Host Response

In sepsis, normally locally controlled host response to infection become dysregulated, leading to collateral damage to blood vessels and host organs such as the kidneys.
